religious.name: Tirumala Venkateswara Temple
religious.description: One of the most famous Hindu temples in the world, dedicated to Lord Venkateswara.

religious.name: Harmandir Sahib (Golden Temple)
religious.description: The holiest Sikh gurdwara, famous for its golden dome and surrounding pool of water.

religious.name: Bodh Gaya
religious.description: A pilgrimage site for Buddhists, where it is believed that Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment.

traditional.name: Jaipur
traditional.description: Known as the 'Pink City' for its distinctive buildings, Jaipur is a popular destination for its forts, palaces, and traditional markets.

traditional.name: Varanasi
traditional.description: One of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world, Varanasi is known for its ghats on the banks of the Ganges River and its Hindu temples.

traditional.name: Kochi
traditional.description: A port city on the southwest coast of India, Kochi is known for its historic fort, Dutch palace, and traditional Chinese fishing nets.

nightlife.name: Goa
nightlife.description: A coastal state known for its beaches, nightlife, and Portuguese colonial architecture.

nightlife.name: Mumbai
nightlife.description: India's financial capital, known for its film industry, nightlife, and colonial-era architecture.

nightlife.name: Bangalore
nightlife.description: Known as the 'Silicon Valley of India', Bangalore is a major IT hub with a thriving nightlife scene.

adventurous.name: Leh
adventurous.description: A high-altitude desert town in the Himalayas, known for its scenic landscapes, Buddhist monasteries, and adventure sports.

adventurous.name: Rishikesh
adventurous.description: A spiritual town on the banks of the Ganges River, known for its adventure sports such as white-water rafting and bungee jumping.

adventurous.name: Manali
adventurous.description: A popular hill station in the Himalayas, known for its scenic beauty and adventure sports such as skiing and trekking.
